opennlp.ccg.disjunctivizer
Class AlignedEdgeFilter

java.lang.Object
  opennlp.ccg.disjunctivizer.MatchTypeFilter
      opennlp.ccg.disjunctivizer.AlignedEdgeFilter
All Implemented Interfaces:
Filter<LFEdge>
public class AlignedEdgeFilter
extends MatchTypeFilter

A filter for edges that tests whether they are aligned based on a specified set of alignment indices. Whether the source or target vertices (or both) is considered depends on the match type criteria in effect. For example, if the match type criteria contains MatchType.SOURCE_ALIGNED, this filter's allows(LFEdge) method will check whether argument edges have a source index that is contained in the set of alignment indices.

Instances of this class use the following match type criteria: MatchType.SOURCE_ALIGNED, MatchType.SOURCE_UNALIGNED, MatchType.TARGET_ALIGNED, and MatchType.TARGET_UNALIGNED. If the set of alignment indices is modified after an instance of this class is created, the filter will reflect the changes because the set is not copied at creation.

Author:
Scott Martin

Constructor Detail

AlignedEdgeFilter

public AlignedEdgeFilter(Set<Integer> alignmentIndices,
                         MatchType... matchTypes)
Creates a new aligned edge filter based on the specified alignment indices for the specified match type criteria.

Parameters:
alignmentIndices - The set of indices to check for alignment.
matchTypes - The match type criteria to use.
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - If alignmentIndices is null.

Method Detail

getAlignmentIndices

public Set<Integer> getAlignmentIndices()
Gets the alignment indices used by this filter.

setAlignmentIndices

public void setAlignmentIndices(Set<Integer> alignmentIndices)
Sets the alignment indices used by this filter.

Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - If alignmentIndices is null.

allows

public boolean allows(LFEdge edge)
Tests whether this filter allows the specified LF edge.

Returns:
false if MatchTypeFilter.getMatchTypes() contains
  • MatchType.SOURCE_ALIGNED, but the alignment indices does not contain the edge's source vertex's index,
  • MatchType.SOURCE_UNALIGNED, but the alignment indices contains the edge's source vertex's index,
  • MatchType.TARGET_ALIGNED, but the alignment indices does not contain the edge's target vertex's index,
  • MatchType.TARGET_UNALIGNED, but the alignment indices contains the edge's target vertex's index,
and true otherwise.
See Also:
getAlignmentIndices(), LFEdge.getSource(), LFEdge.getTarget(), LFVertex.getIndex()
